result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R Reasby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs and surcahrges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, to be paid within the term of Probation in case 13CF2277 (by 12-19-16).   Failure to pay is civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence, Huber for treatment.

Defendant may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven R Reasby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven R Reasby in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Steven R Reasby in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 43 days time served, Huber privileges for treatment.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation in Case 13CF2277, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Steven R Reasby in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Steven R Reasby in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea date scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Milwaukee County Transit System Bus, MCTS Stop, or MCTS shelter.

Defendant Steven R Reasby in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Steven R Reasby in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven R Reasby
Current: 3460 N 14th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 02-05-2014)
Prior: 2602 North 50th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
